intro: Psychotria oleandrella, commonly known as the Caribbean moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking white, night-blooming flowers. The plant has dark green, elliptical leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. The flowers emit a sweet fragrance at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators like moths.
